duties_responsibilities.duty: Collect patient health data, perform initial assessment based on patient's presentation, and record relevant data.
Develop and implement a plan of care, analyze assessment data, and identify expected outcomes for the patient.
Incorporate discharge planning into the admission process and communicate the plan of care to promote continuity of care.
Assist patients and families in identifying and securing services to address health-related needs.
Recognize hazards to patient safety, take action to maintain a safe environment, and provide education to the patient and family.
Document the initial plan of care, provide updates as required, and evaluate the patient's progress toward attainment of outcomes.
Demonstrate ethical beliefs and respect for patient's rights, and participate in the evaluation of the quality and effectiveness of nursing practices.
Maintain knowledge and proficiency in the clinical area and age group served, and comply with staff meeting attendance requirement.

education_certification.credential: Professional knowledge of nursing theory and practice acquired through completion of a two-year training at an accredited School of Nursing, and a current New York State license or permit as a Registered Professional Nurse.
